unnormalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) class 10th results were declared yesterday, and stats are flying around like crazy! Apparently, the overall pass percentage this year dipped by around 2%, settling at 98%. Last year it was almost a perfect 100, right?
normalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (C-B-S-E) class tenth results were declared yesterday, and statistics are flying around like crazy! Apparently, the overall pass percentage this year dipped by around two percent, settling at ninety eight percent. Last year it was almost a perfect one hundred percent, right?

unnormalised: Breaking it down, the standard deviation of marks in Maths was found to be 15. This means, on average, most students scored within 15 marks of the mean score. Someone even calculated the probability of scoring above 90% in Maths, and it's around 0.25, assuming a normal distribution. Good luck next year's batch!
normalised: Breaking it down, the standard deviation of marks in Maths was found to be fifteen. This means, on average, most students scored within fifteen marks of the mean score. Someone even calculated the probability of scoring above ninety percent in Maths, and it's around zero point two five, assuming a normal distribution. Good luck next year's batch!

unnormalised: Folks are already saying that the cut-offs for science in class 11th at top schools like DPS are gonna be sky-high again. Seriously, what are the chances of actually getting your preferred stream with these marks? Someone needs to do some probability analysis on *that* situation!
normalised: Folks are already saying that the cut-offs for science in class eleventh at top schools like D-P-S are going to be sky-high again. Seriously, what are the chances of actually getting your preferred stream with these marks? Someone needs to do some probability analysis on that situation!
